articles.title: Notes on github classrooms and rstudio cloud
articles.description: Some updates about interfacing between github classroom
articles.contents:
Rstudio
Sign-up for a GitHub account. Install R, RStudio, and GIT on your computer.
Students will need to load their GIT config in RStudio. (see section 7,9,11,12 of https://happygitwithr.com/)

Github classrooms
Even if you use the github classroom web api, you may want to install Mine Cetinkaya-Rundel and colleagues’ excellent ghclass package.
Andrew used it to manage the class:
Set up team assignments
Push edits to existing assignments
Clone all student repos for grading, branching, and other housekeeping
Unwatch student repos, so you aren’t buried in github spam whenever your students make commits
Branch against the initial commit (useful for grading via pull requests)
At some point, I will post excerpts from the script I used to manage assignments.
Grading with github classrooms
You can use pull requests, but you’ll need to make sure you have a branch created against the initial commit.
(See previous bullet). Although you can do this post-hoc, life will be easier if you do it ahead of time.
I could not figure out a good way to collaborate with TAs in the grading without sending the students (pre-mature and possibly incorrect) feedback. Basically, a way to mute a pull request before it’s submitted would be useful.

articles.title: BST430 - Introduction to Statistical Computing
articles.contents:
Administrivia
MW 9:10-10:50, SRB 1406
Instructor: Matt McCall
TA: Alex Guo
TA Office Hours: Friday 9-10am in SRB 4.103
Website: https://bst-urmc.github.io/bst430-fall2023-site/
Syllabus
Resources:
1. install GIT
2. install base R
3. install RStudio
Content
Introduction
Meet the toolkit
Invites to GitHub class room are on blackboard
Req readings: r4ds 3.1-3.5, 4.
Optional readings: https://happygitwithr.com/
Lab 0 instructions and repo (accept GH classroom invite in Blackboard).

ggplot(i)
styleguide

dplyr(i)
Continue working on Lab 1

Data types in R.
HW 1 assigned. instructions and repo (accept GH classroom invite).

Reshaping and combining data frames.
Lab 2. You will need to accept the invitation.

dplyr(ii)
Lab 3. invitation here. (Deadline: 30-September 2023 5PM EDT)

Factors and dates
Continue working on Lab 3
HW 2 assigned. instructions and repo (accept GH classroom invite). (Deadline: 09-October 2023 5PM EDT)

Effective data visualization (i) (ii) video
Gapminder
More Hans Rosling
Data from files
Repository for lecture 9 here will not be graded, but gets you everything you need at once.
Lab 4. New groups! At least one new teammate for each person. Invitation here. Deadline: 16-October 2023 5PM EDT

Text processing
HW 3 assigned. instructions and repo (accept GH classroom invite).
Deadline: 23-October 2023 5PM EDT

Text analysis
Reading: r4ds chapter 14
Lab 5. Invitation here.
Deadline: 23-October 2023 5PM EDT
Present one improved plot in class on 16-October 2023

Matrices, indexing, linear algebra
Functions i
Functions ii and iteration
Lab 6
Invitation here
Deadline: 06-November 2023 5PM EDT

Linear models
Knitr tricks and debugging.
Multivariate linear models and Prediction
HW 4 assigned. instructions and repo (accept GH classroom invite).
Deadline: 13-November 2023 5PM EDT

Final Exam.
Remember I will be looking at the .md for results and the .Rmd for your code.
instructions
GH classroom invite.
